business.headline: Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold. The message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

entertainment.headline: Suniel Shetty says he rejected a Rs 40 crore tobacco ad on principle Suniel Shetty has revealed that he refused a Rs 40 crore tobacco endorsement, stating that personal values, health, and his responsibility as a father outweigh financial incentives.

Unlike any other: Sobhita Dhulipala reviews Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Actor Shobhita Dhulipala shared her review of Aditya Dhar directorial Dhurandhar. The sequel of the film is scheduled for release on March 19, 2026.

Athiya Shetty shares unseen photo of Evaarah with KL Rahul on first Christmas Athiya Shetty posted photos on Instagram on December 27, offering a look at her holiday celebrations with cricketer KL Rahul and their daughter Evaarah.

Thalapathy Vijay raises his fist in joy as fans say 2026 is ours. Viral video Actor Vijay responded to a fan's proclamation about 2026 elections with a symbolic gesture during the Jana Nayagan audio launch in Malaysia. The video is now going viral.

How Salman Khan met my mother Kunickaa after 30 years: Ayaan Lall reveals Actor Salman Khan had an unexpected reunion with actor Kunickaa Sadanand, facilitated by her son and fellow actor Ayaan Lall, during the filming of their latest project. The interaction occurred over three decades after their last collaboration, creating a memorable moment on set.

BTS' Kim Taehyung sends Indian fans into a frenzy after almost confirming India tour  BTS' Kim Taehyung, aka V, sparked excitement among Indian fans after greeting them with a "Namaste" and hinting at a possible visit during his latest Weverse live.

Bigg Boss 19's Malti Chahar recalls growing up amid family conflict Bigg Boss 19 finalist Malti Chahar has shared her experiences of growing up amid parental discord, restrictive upbringing, and societal challenges, offering insight into the difficulties faced during her adolescence.

Vijay asks fans to avoid political chants at Jana Nayagan event in Malaysia. Watch Actor Vijay urged his supporters not to chant his political party's name, TVK, during the Jana Nayagan audio launch after Malaysian authorities imposed a strict ban on political speech and symbols at the entertainment-only event.

Fan frenzy greets Vijay at Jana Nayagan audio launch in Kuala Lumpur. Watch video Thousands gather at Bukit Jalil Stadium in Malaysia for the audio launch of Vijay's highly anticipated film Jana Nayagan, amid announcement that this is his final public event as an actor, before focusing on politics.

Jugal Hansraj recalls Shabana Azmi's acting method during Masoom shoot Jugal Hansraj recalled how Shabana Azmi deliberately kept her distance from him during the shooting of Masoom as part of her acting process.

Alia's Alpha postponed to avoid clash with Salman's Battle of Galwan: Trade report Yash Raj Films has postponed the release of the spy thriller Alpha, starring Alia Bhatt and Sharvari, originally set for April 2026, to avoid competing with Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan. The production house is yet to announce a revised release date.

Lokesh Kanagaraj accepts Coolie criticism, says he will improve next film Director Lokesh Kanagaraj responds to criticism of his ensemble film Coolie, starring Rajinikanth, which despite negative reviews has achieved significant box office success.

Mannara Chopra calls Malti a proper LA baby, talks about bond with Priyanka Mannara Chopra opened up about her close bond with Priyanka Chopra, describing her as a guiding sister rather than a godmother figure. She also shared a sweet update about Priyanka's daughter Malti, calling her a proper LA baby who mostly speaks English.

Salman Khan turns 60: Kareena, Anil Kapoor, Kriti Sanon and others wish superstar As Salman Khan turned a year older, actors Kareena Kapoor, Katrina Kaif, Kriti Sanon and Anil Kapoor, among others, wished him on social media. Kapoor welcomed him to the 60s with a heartfelt post.

The Copenhagen Test review: Simu Liu anchors a slick, timely spy thrillerRelease Date:Sun Dec 28, 2025 The Copenhagen Test is a slick sci-fi espionage drama that turns surveillance into a deeply personal threat, following a spy who discovers his own mind is being watched.

AP Dhillon hugs, kisses Tara Sutaria on stage; Veer Pahariya's reaction goes viral Videos from AP Dhillon's Mumbai concert featuring Tara Sutaria, Veer Pahariya spark online discussion, as fans react to onstage moments between Sutaria and the singer.

Salman Khan takes charge in Battle of Galwan teaser, April release set. Watch The teaser for Battle of Galwan, starring Salman Khan, has been launched on the actor's 60th birthday. The film is slated for release in April 2026.

Allu Arjun among 23 named in chargesheet pertaining to Pushpa 2 stampede of 2024 Allu Arjun has been named among 23 accused in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case of December 2024, with Hyderabad Police filing a detailed 100-page chargesheet over alleged crowd management failures.

Anupam Kher praises Dhurandhar, calls film's success a slap to propaganda critics Anupam Kher praised the massive success of Dhurandhar, calling it a strong reply to those who labelled the film as propaganda and applauding Aditya Dhar's conviction-driven filmmaking.

general news.headline: Supreme Court takes note of Aravalli row, CJI-led bench to hear matter on MondayThe hearing comes after the Centre ordered a complete ban on new mining leases across the Aravalli range from Delhi to Gujarat, and reiterated that existing mines must comply strictly with environmental safeguards and Supreme Court orders.

No bulldozer culture here: DK Shivakumar vs Pinarayi Vijayan on demolition driveKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said Pinarayi Vijayan had commented on the issue of demolition drive in Bengaluru "without knowing the facts of the matter."

Over 10.56 lakh names dropped from Assam's draft SIR voter rollOfficials said the deletions mainly stem from three reasons: deaths, people moving out of their registered addresses, and duplicate entries.

Winter storm disrupts air travel across US Northeast, thousands of flights cancelled  Live updatesA fast-moving winter storm brought snow and ice to the US Northeast, triggering states of emergency, hazardous travel conditions and widespread flight cancellations during the busy post-holiday travel period.

Before K-wave came to India, an Ayodhya princess took India wave to KoreaA bronze statue of Korean Queen Heo Hwang-ok was unveiled in Ayodhya this week. Long before K-pop and K-drama influenced Indians, it was an Indian princess who travelled to Korea in the first century AD and became Queen Heo. She introduced Indian spices and silk to Korean culture.

Zelenskyy visits Canada en route to US for Trump meet as Russia pounds UkraineUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met Canada's prime minister en route to US talks with Donald Trump, hours after Russia launched a massive drone and missile attack on Kyiv and claimed new battlefield gains.

This country deported most Indians in past 5 years. No, it's not USThe figures underline the scale of migration-related violations in the Gulf region, particularly involving visa overstays and labour law breaches, rather than illegal border crossings.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi in line for U19 World Cup debut as BCCI names 15-man squadVaibhav Suryavanshi is all set to make his bow in the U19 World Cup for India as BCCI announced the squad for the upcoming tournament on Saturday, December 27. Ayush Mhatre will be captaining the side during the tournament.

Drishyam 3 producer sends legal notice to Akshaye Khanna: Success went to his headProducer Kumar Mangat Pathak confirmed Jaideep Ahlawat has taken over Akshaye Khanna's role in Drishyam 3. He accused the Dhurandhar actor of unprofessional conduct and confirmed sending him a legal notice.

Rift out in open? Digvijaya Singh stirs row with photo of PM Modi, RSS praiseDigvijaya Singh's post is being interpreted by many as a pointed message at the Congress leadership. In the throwback image, a young Modi is seen sitting on the floor near BJP veteran LK Advani.

Delhi makes 'no fuel without pollution certificate' rule permanentPetrol pumps across Delhi have been barred from dispensing fuel to vehicles that do not possess valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificates. Delhi environment minister said that the restriction will be made permanent.

71 blasphemy-linked attacks on Hindus across Bangladesh in 6 months: ReportThe report documents cases from more than 30 districts and pointed out that the similarity of the blasphemy-linked allegations against Hindus points to systemic targeting in Bangladesh.

China's maglev train touches 700 kmph speed in 2 seconds, shatters speed recordThe landmark test was conducted on a 400-meter experimental track and demonstrated not only ultra-rapid acceleration but also precise and safe braking.

5,000 doctors, 11,000 engineers exit. Pak mocks Asim Munir's 'brain gain' claimPakistan has lost 5,000 doctors and 11,000 engineers over the past 24 months, as per a government report. It has prompted Pakistanis to ridicule army chief Asim Munir, who recently tried to put a positive spin on the mass migration and called it 'brain gain'.

Who is Zaima Rahman, the new player in Bangladesh's political field?Back in Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, BNP's de-facto chief Tarique Rahman has introduced another element in Dhaka's politics, his daughter Zaima. A London-trained barrister who talks of Khaleda as "dadu", Zaima is taking her first cautious steps into Bangladesh's political maze.

Bhajan Clubbing joins the multi-day Indian wedding rosterThe bhajan clubbing fervour has entered the Indian wedding scene and is now being seen as an elaborate addition to the shaadi celebration roster.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

A rapist is a rapist: Unnao survivor says power can't dilute case, flags CBI delayThe CBI's delayed challenge to Kuldeep Singh Sengar's sentence suspension has drawn sharp criticism from the survivor, who highlights the lack of timely support during her legal battle.

Pune couple separate 24 hours after wedding, were in relationship for over 2 yearsThe couple knew each other for 2–3 years prior to their wedding, said the advocate who facilitated the divorce. The two had a disagreement about their future living arrangements.

Why India faced disasters on 99% of days in 2025, and what's nextIndia faced relentless extreme weather events for 331 days in 2025, claiming thousands of lives and ravaging millions of hectares of crops. Urgent global mitigation and local resilient farming are now the only paths to survival.

Massive pre-New Year crackdown in Delhi: Over 600 arrested; weapons, drugs seizedDelhi Police launched a massive overnight crackdown under Operation Aaghat, arresting over 600 people and seizing weapons, drugs, and cash to curb organised crime ahead of New Year celebrations.

Too many toppers, too few seats: Why 99.99 percentile isn't enough in CAT anymoreCAT has entered a new phase of extreme competition with top percentile clusters rising dramatically. With dozens of candidates packed into the top 0.01 percentile bands, marginal score differences now decide elite IIM calls. An analysis of five years of CAT data explains why coaching, normalisation and rising aspirant numbers and quality have resulted in a cut-throat fight for IIM seats.

Woman proudly shows first YouTube income at 52, daughter shares viral videoA 52-year-old woman earns her first income through YouTube, and the emotional moment was filmed by her daughter and shared on social media.

sports.headline: World Rapid C'ships: Gukesh, Erigaisi remain in hunt, Carlsen suffers rare loss D Gukesh continued his strong performance to remain in the hunt at the FIDE World Rapid Championship after nine rounds, with Vladislav Artemiev and Hans Niemann leading the standings. In the women's section, defending champion Koneru Humpy stays at the top of the standings.

Ganguly starts coaching stint with loss as Jo'burg Super Kings down Pretoria Capitals Sourav Ganguly's coaching tenure with the Pretoria Capitals started with a loss as they were beaten by the Jo'burg Super Kings in the SA20 on Saturday, December 27.

Stokes comes down heavy on Melbourne pitch: Hell would be unleashed elsewhere England ended their 18-Test winless streak in Australia by chasing down 175 for a four-wicket victory at the MCG, but concerns were raised over the playing surface after the match concluded within two days.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi named India captain for South Africa ODIs ahead of U19 World Cup Vaibhav Suryavanshi has been appointed captain of the India U19 team for the South Africa ODI series, following his record-breaking century in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Ayush Mhatre will miss the series due to a wrist injury, but will play in the U19 World Cup next year.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi in line for U19 World Cup debut as BCCI names 15-man squad Vaibhav Suryavanshi is all set to make his bow in the U19 World Cup for India as BCCI announced the squad for the upcoming tournament on Saturday, December 27. Ayush Mhatre will be captaining the side during the tournament.

CSK new recruit Matthew Short stuns with stellar all-round show in BBL Matthew Short, CSK's new all-round recruit, impressed with a blistering 63 and 2 wickets in the BBL, though his efforts couldn't prevent Adelaide Strikers from losing by 7 runs to Brisbane Heat.

Shaheen Shah Afridi in big trouble, Pakistan suffer injury scare before T20 World Cup Shaheen Shah Afridi's knee injury during the BBL 2025-26 clash against Adelaide Strikers on Saturday raises concerns for Pakistan ahead of the 2026 edition of the Men's World Cup.

Frustrated with arm injury, Jack Draper pulls out of Australian Open 2026 British tennis player Jack Draper has withdrawn from the 2025 Australian Open due to a persistent left arm injury, disappointing fans and leaving a spot open in the men's singles draw.

Women's World Cup loss vs India still hurts, revenge is on our minds: Australia pacer Kim Garth shared that Australia are still feeling the sting of their semi-final loss to India in the Women's World Cup, but is looking forward to the upcoming bilateral series with India in 2026.

Yashasvi Jaiswal or Tere Naam's Salman? How Kohli teased batter during his 1st ODI hundred Yashasvi Jaiswal revealed the funny side of batting alongside Virat Kohli and how the Indian star teased him with Salman Khan's Tere Naam song during his knock against South Africa in the third ODI.

Cricket Australia flags concern over short Tests after MCG game: Bad for businessCricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg has voiced serious concerns amid the two-day finish of the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, warning that short Tests are not good for business.

A lot thrown at this team: Root praises England's response after difficult Ashes tourJoe Root praised England's character after a rare Test win in Australia, saying the team responded strongly under pressure despite losing the Ashes series earlier in the tour.

Tragedy in Bangladesh Premier League: Dhaka coach dies after heart attack on fieldBangladesh Premier League 2026: Dhaka Capitals' assistant coach Mahbub Ali Zaki tragically passed away from a heart attack on the field just before their BPL opening match against Rajshahi Warriors on December 27.

Melbourne Test hero Tongue reveals he almost retired: Glad I stuck with cricketJosh Tongue revealed that he considered retiring from cricket following a string of injuries that has disrupted his international career for England. Tongue was the hero for England in Melbourne as they beat Australia in the 4th Ashes 2025 Test.

Only good cricket matters: Ben Stokes proud of England's MCG win despite Noosa rowAUS vs ENG 4th Ashes Test: Ben Stokes led with calm as England delivered a landmark MCG Test win. Amid the Noosa row noise, his side stayed focused on cricket alone to end a 14-year wait in Australia.

Smith slams MCG pitch after 2-day finish: 36 wickets in 2 days are too muchAshes 2025-26: Australia vice-captain Steve Smith criticised the Melbourne pitch after England's 4-wicket win in the fourth Ashes Test. The bowler-friendly surface sparked debate as 36 wickets fell inside two days to produce a result.

No more angry Stuart Broad: Former England pacer relishes historic MCG Test winFrom despair in Perth to delight in Melbourne, Stuart Broad lived England's Ashes journey in full. The former pacer's reaction mirrored a historic Test win that finally ended England's long wait in Australia.

We'll prepare together: Jaiswal opens up on Rohit Sharma's role in India debutEarly clarity, simple advice and constant backing from Rohit Sharma helped Yashasvi Jaiswal settle his nerves and make a memorable start to his international career in the West Indies.

India Women rout Sri Lanka, but are lopsided games hurting T20 World Cup prep?IND vs SL, 3rd T20I: India clinched the T20I series 3-0 against Sri Lanka on Friday, but how much has the victory contributed to their preparations for next year's Women's T20 World Cup?

Watch: England fans take over the MCG as 14-year wait ends with historic Test winThe Barmy Army finally had its moment at the MCG after 14 long years. England's dramatic Test win sparked white-and-red celebrations, chants and scenes of joy as a painful Ashes drought in Australia ended.

England's gamble with Brydon Carse at 3, an idea Shane Warne already had envisionedEngland's bold decision to send Brydon Carse to No.3 at the MCG echoed a Shane Warne idea from 2021, disrupting Australia's plans and helping end a 15-year wait for a Test win Down Under.

Australia face T20 World Cup scare after Tim David suffers injury in Big BashAustralia's T20 World Cup build-up has hit a speed bump with Tim David injured. The powerful batter's hamstring concern now puts his availability in doubt just weeks before the tournament in India and Sri Lanka.

Ashes: England end 5,468-day drought in Australia with 4-wicket win at MCGAUS vs ENG 4th Ashes Test: England have ended a 5,468-day wait to win a Test match in Australia as they won the fourth Ashes Test by four wickets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Josh Tongue was adjudged Player of the Match for taking 7/89 in the match.

Rich BCCI, poor treatment: Indian cricket fans recall stadium experienceWatching live sport should be a once-in-a-lifetime thrill. But in India, it too often becomes a test of patience, despite the BCCI being among the richest sporting bodies in the world. Fans who spend big bucks to watch their cricketing stars live deserve a far better deal from the administrators.

Kohli signs match ball for Vishal Jayswal, the Gujarat spinner who dismissed himGujarat bowler Vishal Jayswal had the day of his life after dismissing Virat Kohli in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26. He picked up 4 wickets to restrict Delhi to 254/9 and got the match ball signed by the star batter after the match.

Watch: Kylian Mbappe turns fan, dons Achraf Hakimi jersey during Morocco's AFCON clashKylian Mbappe attended Morocco's AFCON group match against Mali from the stands in Rabat. The Real Madrid forward wore Achraf Hakimi's jersey, backing his close friend during the tournament.

MS Dhoni celebrates Salman Khan's 60th birthday at actor's farmhouseMS Dhoni was seen at Salman Khan's 60th birthday bash held at his Panvel farmhouse. He attended the event alongside wife Sakshi Dhoni and daughter Ziva Dhoni.

Robert Lewandowski hints at future away from FC Barcelona: Don't know where I'll playRobert Lewandowski's future at Barcelona hangs in the balance as contract talks stall. With Saudi and MLS interest growing, the veteran striker has time, options, and no pressure as a pivotal decision looms.

England's injury woes continue as Gus Atkinson pulls hamstring in MelbourneGus Atkinson suffered a hamstring injury during Day 2 of the fourth Ashes Test. His injury adds him to the list of English bowlers who've suffered concerns during the ongoing series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
